items.title: Double Bachelor's in Mathematics and Computer Science
items.subtitle: Université Paris - Saclay

items.title: Enhancing Supercomputer Tracking Tool
items.subtitle: CEA
items.description: Development and optimization of software tools for scientific data analysis.
items.fullDescription:
The main goal of this internship was to improve a supercomputer usage tracking tool used by the CEA Energy Department.

## Key Objectives

The main objectives of this internship were:
- **Data Collection**: The primary task was to gather data from a website and a terminal regarding the usage of machines by CNRS and CINES. The data had to be extracted, standardized, and stored in a database for further analysis.
- **Data Analysis**: Subsequently, data analysis was performed to track each user's daily usage. This analysis is available through daily reports emailed to lab managers and on a dedicated website.
- **Website Restoration**: Another responsibility was to restore the functionality of a website using the Django framework. The site code was reorganized using the Model-View-Controller pattern to improve code structure and maintainability.
- **SQL Query Optimization**: It was also necessary to redesign the SQL queries used for data storage to make them more efficient and facilitate code maintenance.

items.title: Unsupervised Machine Learning
items.subtitle: Enedis
items.description: Intelligent detection of incidents on the French electrical network.
items.fullDescription:
The internship focuses on analyzing incidents in the French electrical network, aiming to design an **unsupervised machine learning** model capable of automatically detecting and identifying the **affected electrical substations** during a failure.

## Main Approaches

The internship combines two main approaches:
- **Multivariate Time Series Clustering**: This method allows detecting patterns and anomalies in voltage data.
- **Network Topology Analysis via Graphs**: Helps understand interconnections between electrical substations.

## Main Internship Steps

1. **Data Collection and Preparation**  
The first step involved extracting a large volume of voltage log data from the information system using SQL queries.
2. **Time Series Processing and Analysis**  
Once collected, specific methods were applied to normalize and analyze the multivariate time series, identifying recurring patterns and anomalies indicative of incidents.
3. **Modeling and Optimization**  
A clustering model based on the **HDBSCAN** algorithm was developed and optimized. This algorithm handles data complexity and noise effectively, enabling relevant grouping of incidents.
4. **Integration of Topological Data**  
To improve model accuracy, substation topology data was integrated. **Node2Vec** embedding was used to convert these data into a format usable by the clustering model.
5. **Performance Evaluation**  
Finally, the model's performance was evaluated and compared with existing solutions, measuring its accuracy in identifying affected substations.

items.title: National Student Entrepreneur Status
items.subtitle: Pépite PEIPS
items.description: Recognition of entrepreneurial skills and support for project development.

items.title: Energy Performance Modeling
items.subtitle: E-nno
items.description: Modeling and analyzing building energy performance to detect and prevent drops in efficiency.
items.fullDescription:
This internship, conducted at E-nno, focused on developing tools to analyze and improve building energy performance, with a focus on HVAC systems, domestic hot water, and solar thermal systems. The goal was to characterize building energy behavior and automatically detect performance drops.

## Main Approaches

The internship combines several approaches:

- **Statistical Modeling and Machine Learning**: To model building thermal profiles and solar thermal production from collected data.
- **Time Series Analysis and Anomaly Detection**: To monitor performance variations and identify malfunctions.

## Steps and Achievements

1. **Energy System Modeling**: Development of machine learning algorithms to build models capable of characterizing building energy behavior.
2. **Analysis Pipeline Construction**: Creation of a complete workflow to analyze a given period of a building and generate a thermal profile characterization.
3. **Business Tool Development**: Design of an intuitive Streamlit interface, facilitating access to analyses and result interpretation for internal teams.
4. **Alert System Implementation**: Integration of a monitoring system with Airflow to signal drops in solar thermal performance and enable proactive intervention.

## Internship Impact

- Improved understanding of building energy behavior.
- Enhanced decision-making through automated and summarized analyses.
- Provided a practical tool to advise clients and identify performance drop points.
